opinion.title: Life Better Today
opinion.topic: Quality of Life: Past vs Present
opinion.question: 'Life is better today than it was 100 years ago.' Do you agree?
opinion.answer:
Despite nostalgia for the past, life today is better than it was 100 years ago. Over recent years, people have debated whether progress has improved our lives. I firmly believe that developments in health and technology have made life far better.

First of all, modern healthcare has changed wellbeing. This is because illnesses that were once deadly can now be treated. For example, vaccines have removed diseases like polio. As a result, people live much longer. This shows that health is far better today.

Furthermore, entertainment has been completely changed. Thanks to the internet, people can enjoy music and films from anywhere. For instance, video calls let families stay connected. Consequently, relationships are easier to maintain.

In conclusion, I am convinced that life today is much better than 100 years ago. Taking everything into account, improvements in health and technology show clear progress.

opinion.title: Work: Money vs Enjoyment
opinion.question: Is it better to earn a lot of money or to enjoy your job?
writingPoints: how much time is spent at work
the type of work which is done
job satisfaction and mental health (your own idea)
opinion.answer:
Few people would deny that work is an important part of life. In recent times, job satisfaction has sparked debate compared to high salaries. Therefore, it is vital we analyse the benefits and drawbacks of earning money versus enjoying work.

The main advantage of earning high salaries is that money improves life. One major benefit is that well-paid workers can afford better housing. For example, a high salary lets people support their families. Another strong point is that we spend lots of time working. This means earning good money makes those hours worthwhile.

While there are many advantages of high salaries, enjoying work matters too. The key disadvantage of focusing only on money is that job satisfaction suffers. A major drawback is that people in boring jobs often feel unhappy. One negative aspect is that stressful jobs can damage mental health.

In conclusion, as far as I am concerned, both money and enjoyment are important. On balance, it seems that enjoyment is more important for happiness, despite financial pressures. A balance between the two is best.

opinion.title: Saving Endangered Animals
opinion.question: Should we do everything possible to save endangered animals?
writingPoints: the kind of animals in danger
opinion.answer:
Across the world today, many animals are at risk of disappearing. Because of this, people debate whether we should protect them. I strongly believe that protecting endangered animals is essential.

To begin with, many unique species are in danger. This is largely because hunting and pollution have reduced their numbers. For example, tigers and rhinos are close to extinction. As a result, we are losing important animals. This shows why action is needed.

Furthermore, there are good reasons for protecting these animals. This is because they play important roles in nature. For instance, bees help crops grow. Consequently, losing species would harm humans too.

In conclusion, I strongly believe endangered animals must be protected. Considering all the evidence, saving species helps the environment and future generations.

opinion.title: Friends vs Family
opinion.question: Which is more important â€“ friends or family?
writingPoints: who will help you when you have problems
opinion.answer:
Few people would deny that relationships are an essential part of life. In recent times, friendships have sparked debate about their value. Therefore, it is vital we analyse the benefits of both friends and family.

The main advantage of friends is that they are fun to be with. One major benefit is that friends share similar interests. For example, people choose friends to play sports or relax with. As a result, friendships create enjoyable times.

While there are many advantages of friends, family provides stronger support. The key disadvantage of relying only on friends is that they may not always help. A major drawback is that friends may move away. Family members usually help when we have problems. For instance, parents offer support when needed.

In conclusion, as far as I am concerned, both friends and family are important. On balance, it seems that family support is stronger in difficult times. A balance between the two is healthiest.

opinion.title: Environment & Pollution
opinion.question: Do you think the world's pollution problems can be solved?
opinion.answer:
Pollution is one of the most serious problems today. Because of this, many people wonder if it can be solved. I believe that practical solutions exist.

To begin with, transport causes pollution. This is because millions of cars produce harmful gases. For example, cities suffer from high air pollution. As a result, people develop breathing problems. This shows why cleaner transport is essential.

Furthermore, rivers and seas are polluted. This happens because factories release chemicals into water. For instance, many sea animals die from plastic. Consequently, ecosystems are damaged.

In conclusion, I believe pollution can be reduced. Overall, improving transport, protecting water and using clean energy will help our planet.

opinion.title: Technology & Social Interaction
opinion.question: Is technology making us less sociable?
opinion.answer:
Few people would deny that technology is an essential part of daily life. In recent times, digital communication has sparked debate. Therefore, it is vital we analyse the benefits and drawbacks of technology.

The main advantage of technology is that it connects people. One major benefit is that social media allows instant communication. For example, families can stay in touch across distances. As a result, long-distance relationships are easier.

While there are many advantages of technology, it can reduce face-to-face interaction. The key disadvantage of technology is that it encourages screen time. A major drawback is that families sit together without speaking. One negative aspect is that it reduces physical interaction.

In conclusion, as far as I am concerned, technology has advantages and disadvantages. On balance, it seems that technology is helpful when used responsibly. Overall, both online and face-to-face communication are important.

opinion.title: Gap Year
opinion.question: Is taking a gap year before university a good idea?
opinion.answer:
In recent times, gap years have sparked debate. It is widely recognised that taking a year off can have positive and negative effects. Therefore, it is vital we analyse the benefits and drawbacks of gap years.

The main advantage of taking a gap year is gaining experience. One major benefit is that young people can travel or work. For example, some volunteer abroad to learn new skills. As a result, they become more independent.

While there are many advantages, gap years present challenges. The key disadvantage of taking time off is losing academic momentum. A major drawback is that returning to study can be difficult. One negative aspect is that motivation may decrease. Financial considerations are also important. For instance, gap years require money for travel.

In conclusion, as far as I am concerned, gap years have advantages and disadvantages. On balance, the experience benefits motivated students. The decision depends on individual circumstances.

opinion.title: Online Shopping
opinion.question: Is online shopping better than shopping in traditional stores?
writingPoints: trying products before buying (your own idea)
opinion.answer:
In recent times, online shopping has become very popular. It is widely recognised that it can have positive and negative effects. Therefore, it is vital we analyse the benefits and drawbacks.

The main advantage of online shopping is convenience. One major benefit is that people can shop anytime from home. For example, busy workers can order late at night. As a result, shopping becomes easier. Online stores often have lower prices too.

While there are many advantages, online shopping harms local businesses. The key disadvantage is that small shops lose customers. A major drawback is that many shops now close. One clear limitation is that customers cannot try products first. For instance, buying clothes without trying them often causes problems.

In conclusion, as far as I am concerned, online shopping has advantages and disadvantages. On balance, it is convenient but harms local shops. Both methods have value.

opinion.title: Childhood Obesity
opinion.question: What can be done to reduce childhood obesity?
opinion.answer:
Childhood obesity is a serious problem. Because of this, people search for solutions. I believe several steps can help.

Firstly, unhealthy eating is a major cause. This is because many children eat sugary snacks. For example, fast food is cheap and available. As a result, children eat too many calories. This shows why diet must change.

Secondly, lack of exercise contributes to obesity. Because children spend hours on screens, they move less. For instance, many prefer video games to outdoor play. Consequently, fitness levels fall. Schools can promote healthier lifestyles by teaching nutrition.

In conclusion, childhood obesity can be reduced. Overall, healthier eating, more exercise and school support are key steps.

opinion.title: Social Media Addiction
opinion.question: What are the causes and effects of social media addiction?
opinion.answer:
Nowadays, social media addiction has become significant. Hence, it is vital to examine the main causes and effects.

One of the main causes is constant notifications. A major reason is that alerts make users check phones repeatedly. For example, messages appear instantly all day. Another important cause is social comparison. People see idealised images of others' lives.

As a result, addiction has become common among young people. For instance, many upload photos hoping for likes. One major effect is damaged mental health. As a consequence, many experience anxiety and low self-esteem. Addiction affects sleep quality and schoolwork too.

To sum up, social media addiction has led to serious effects. Overall, understanding the causes is the first step towards reducing effects.

opinion.title: Family Size
opinion.question: Is it better to be part of a large family or a small family?
opinion.answer:
In recent times, family size has sparked debate. It is widely recognised that both large and small families have positive and negative aspects. Therefore, it is vital we analyse the benefits and drawbacks.

The main advantage of large families is that children learn from siblings. One major benefit is that having brothers and sisters teaches sharing. For example, older children can help younger ones. As a result, children develop social skills.

While there are many advantages, small families offer benefits. The key disadvantage of large families is less individual attention. A major drawback is that parents have limited time for each child. Small families provide more focused support. For instance, children may get more help with homework.

In conclusion, as far as I am concerned, both family sizes have advantages. On balance, individual attention is important for development. The best size depends on circumstances.

opinion.title: Working From Home
opinion.question: Do you agree that working from home is better than working in an office?
opinion.answer:
Nowadays, working from home has become common. Therefore, it is important to examine arguments both in favour of and against this trend.

One strong argument in favour of working from home is saving time. A major reason is that it removes commuting. For example, employees save two hours daily. As a result, they feel less tired. Working from home also offers comfort. People can create their own workspace.

On the other hand, critics argue that working from home causes isolation. Many people oppose remote work because it reduces social interaction. For example, office workers build friendships. As a result, they feel more connected.

In conclusion, I firmly believe that working from home is generally better. While offices support social contact, remote work saves time and improves comfort. On balance, remote work brings more advantages.

opinion.title: Fashion Industry
opinion.question: Does the fashion industry have a bad effect on people's lives?
opinion.answer:
The fashion industry has a strong influence on daily life. Because of this, people ask whether its impact is positive or negative. I believe it creates problems.

To begin with, pressure to look fashionable affects confidence. This is because adverts show unrealistic beauty standards. For example, many teenagers feel unhappy following trends. As a result, self-esteem suffers. This shows how fashion can be harmful.

Additionally, fashionable clothes are expensive. For instance, families feel pressure to buy branded items. Consequently, this creates financial stress. Fast fashion also harms the environment by creating waste.

In conclusion, I believe the fashion industry has a negative impact. Taking everything into account, it creates pressure, encourages overspending and damages the environment.

opinion.title: Learning Foreign Languages
opinion.question: Are there more reasons to learn a foreign language than just passing a test?
opinion.answer:
Learning a foreign language is becoming important. Because of this, people ask whether learning is valuable beyond exams. I believe it brings many benefits.

To begin with, learning a language can be enjoyable. This is because discovering new words is exciting. For example, people enjoy speaking a new language when travelling. As a result, learning becomes meaningful.

Furthermore, studying a language offers a challenge. For instance, completing a course makes students feel proud. Learning a language also creates career opportunities. Because companies work internationally, knowing a language is valuable.

In conclusion, I strongly believe there are many reasons to learn beyond exams. Overall, it provides enjoyment, challenges and opportunities.

opinion.title: Learning History at School
opinion.question: Should everyone be taught the history of their own country?
opinion.answer:
Learning history is an important part of education. Because of this, people ask whether everyone should learn national history. I believe studying history is essential.

Firstly, people learn lessons from the past. This is because history shows how events shape society. For example, learning about wars teaches the importance of peace. As a result, students become responsible citizens.

Secondly, thinking only about the future is not enough. Because past mistakes repeat themselves, understanding history helps. For instance, past failures guide better choices today. National identity is also important because history helps people understand culture.

In conclusion, I strongly believe everyone should learn national history. Taking everything into account, it teaches lessons and strengthens identity.

opinion.title: Money for Sports People
opinion.question: Are famous sports people paid too much money?
opinion.answer:
In modern society, famous sports people earn high salaries. Because of this, people question whether these earnings are fair. I think many sports stars are paid too much.

Firstly, athletes deserve pay because they provide entertainment. This is because major sports events attract large audiences. For example, football matches are watched by millions. As a result, athletes become valuable. This explains why salaries rise.

Secondly, many athletes work hard. Because they train for years, they sacrifice free time. For instance, Olympic athletes train for hours daily. However, sponsorship pushes salaries to unrealistic levels. Since stars earn millions for adverts, their income no longer reflects sport.

In conclusion, sports people work hard and entertain millions. However, their sponsorship deals show they are often paid too much. Overall, salaries should be more balanced.

opinion.title: Self-Employment vs Working for Others
opinion.question: Is it better to be self-employed or to work for somebody else?
opinion.answer:
In recent times, self-employment has sparked debate. It is widely recognised that both self-employment and traditional jobs have positive and negative aspects. Therefore, it is vital we analyse the benefits and drawbacks.

The main advantage of self-employment is independence. One major benefit is that people choose their own hours. For example, freelancers work when they feel productive. As a result, they feel motivated.

While there are many advantages, traditional jobs provide security. The key disadvantage of self-employment is unpredictable income. A major drawback is that freelancers don't receive regular salaries. Traditional employment offers job security. For instance, employees receive regular pay and benefits.

In conclusion, as far as I am concerned, both options have advantages and disadvantages. On balance, job security is important for most people. Both options can be beneficial in different ways.

opinion.title: Advertising and Society
opinion.question: Is advertising a very good thing for society?
opinion.answer:
Advertising is everywhere in modern life. Because of this, people debate whether advertising is good for society. I believe advertising often has negative effects.

Firstly, advertising keeps people informed. This is because companies show new products. For example, customers learn about special offers. As a result, shopping becomes easier.

Secondly, advertising encourages competition. This is because businesses must improve quality. For instance, companies may lower prices. Consequently, customers benefit. However, advertising can manipulate consumers. Since adverts create unrealistic expectations, people buy unnecessary things.

In conclusion, advertising has advantages and disadvantages. Although it informs customers, it can pressure them to spend money. Overall, advertising is not always good for society.

opinion.title: Helping Other People
opinion.question: Should everyone regularly do something to help other people?
opinion.answer:
Helping others is an important part of community life. Because of this, people ask whether everyone should regularly help. I believe everyone should contribute.

Firstly, helping friends and family strengthens relationships. This is because offering support builds trust. For example, helping a friend brings people closer. As a result, relationships improve.

Secondly, giving back to society is important. Because communities function better when people help each other, it makes a positive difference. For instance, volunteering improves life for everyone. Helping others also supports personal development by building empathy.

In conclusion, I believe everyone should regularly help others. Overall, it strengthens relationships, improves communities and supports growth.

opinion.title: Online Learning
opinion.question: Is online learning better than traditional classroom learning?
opinion.answer:
In recent times, online learning has sparked debate. It is widely recognised that both online and classroom learning have positive and negative impacts. Therefore, it is vital we analyse the benefits and drawbacks.

The main advantage of online learning is flexibility. One major benefit is that students can study anytime. For example, learners can watch lessons late at night. As a result, education becomes more accessible.

While there are many advantages, classrooms provide important benefits. The key disadvantage of online learning is reduced social interaction. A major drawback is that students miss face-to-face communication. Self-discipline is crucial for success. For instance, some students struggle with motivation at home.

In conclusion, as far as I am concerned, both methods have advantages and disadvantages. On balance, classroom learning is better for most students. A combination may be most effective.
